page.title: 15HARMONDSWORTH VILLAGE
page.content: Harmondsworth village is situated to the south of West Drayton. It is a conservation area and as a result has managed to keep its village atmosphere. This is partly because many old victorian houses still remain. It has two churches, St.Mary's and a Baptist church, a village green, two pubs and a school. One of the oldest buildings is the Tithe Barn in a field next to the church. It was built in the 14th or 15th century and is 191 feet long and 38 feet wide. Near Hatch Lane junction one can see what were once old farm cottages. These were used in the Second World War to house Italian prisoners.
